text.__SUMMARY__: Candida bracarensis is an anamorphic yeast species with type strain 153MT (=CBS 10154T =NCYC D3853T =CECT 12000T).
text.Further reading:
Warren, T. A.; McTaggart, L.; Richardson, S. E.; Zhang, S. X. (2010). "Candida bracarensis Bloodstream Infection in an Immunocompromised Patient". Journal of Clinical Microbiology. 48 (12): 4677–4679. doi:10.1128/JCM.01447-10. ISSN 0095-1137. PMC 3008444. PMID 20881164.
Lockhart, S. R.; Messer, S. A.; Gherna, M.; Bishop, J. A.; Merz, W. G.; Pfaller, M. A.; Diekema, D. J. (2009). "Identification of Candida nivariensis and Candida bracarensis in a Large Global Collection of Candida glabrata Isolates: Comparison to the Literature". Journal of Clinical Microbiology. 47 (4): 1216–7. doi:10.1128/JCM.02315-08. PMC 2668319. PMID 19193845.
Bishop, J. A.; Chase, N.; Magill, S. S.; Kurtzman, C. P.; Fiandaca, M. J.; Merz, W. G. (2007). "Candida bracarensis Detected among Isolates of Candida glabrata by Peptide Nucleic Acid Fluorescence In Situ Hybridization: Susceptibility Data and Documentation of Presumed Infection". Journal of Clinical Microbiology. 46 (2): 443–6. doi:10.1128/JCM.01986-07. PMC 2238114. PMID 18077641.
Cuenca-Estrella, M.; Gomez-Lopez, A.; Isla, G.; Rodriguez, D.; Almirante, B.; Pahissa, A.; Rodriguez-Tudela, J. L. (2011). "Prevalence of Candida bracarensis and Candida nivariensisin a Spanish collection of yeasts: comparison of results from a reference centre and from a population-based surveillance study of candidemia". Medical Mycology. 49 (5): 1–5. doi:10.3109/13693786.2010.546373. PMID 21198347.
Esposto, M. C.; Prigitano, A.; Romeo, O.; Criseo, G.; Trovato, L.; Tullio, V.; Fadda, M. E.; Tortorano, A. M. (2013). "Looking for Candida nivariensis and C. bracarensis among a large Italian collection of C. glabrataisolates: results of the FIMUA working group". Mycoses. 56 (3): 394–6. doi:10.1111/myc.12026. PMID 23170902.
